intro: Glomera pungens, commonly known as the spiked glomera, is a striking plant native to the tropical regions of South America. The plant belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton, and is known for its hairy, glandular leaves. Glomera pungens thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in rainforests. Its unique floral structure and ecological role make it an important species in its native habitat.
